thread.title: Wanted by the feds: More solar panels on commercial rooftops
thread.title_full: Wanted by the feds: More solar panels on commercial rooftops

title: Wanted by the feds: More solar panels on commercial rooftops
text:
DOE’s information request comes in the wake of news that Target Corp. (NYSE: TGT) plans to have rooftop solar projects on as many as 30 stores in North Carolina by the end of the year . Target is working to have 500 stores nationwide with rooftop solar installations by 2020. In recent years, big box retail outlets have been making significant progress in deploying rooftop solar systems. Wal-Mart (NYSE: WMT) leads the retail sector by a significant margin. The company’s stores produced 105 megawatts of power last year, according to the Solar Energy Industries Association . SEIA reports that eight of the top 13 companies generating power from solar installations are big-box retailers. Along with Wal-Mart and Target, the list includes Costco (Nasdaq: COST), Macy’s (NYSE: M), Kohl’s (NYSE: KSS), and Bed Bath & Beyond (Nasdaq: BBBY).
